sect1.title: Conventions
sect1.para: A note on the typographical conventions that have been used in this text:
This is the normal font type used for ordinary text.
sect1.programlisting: This monospaced font is used to describe program code.
sect1.screen: This monospaced font is used to describe screen output, differentiated from code if required.

tip.title: This See Also:
tip.para: is a tip used for cross-referencing material either within the documentation, or externally.

note.title: This Note:
note.para: is a note used for revealing a point of interest or special feature

sect1.para: Special formatting is used to highlight functions() and their parameters above the rest of the text.
Important keywords are emphasized using bolding (or strong character typing) and text that is very important and must be noticed is displayed in a traditional red warning color
